title: People Partner (HRBP)
content:
About Glovo:
We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.At Glovo, you’ll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives… all while having fun!We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds. In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your work-life opportunity:
As a People Partner for Bulgaria and Serbia, you will play a key role in impacting business results by helping leaders to make great “people decisions”. You will be the main point of contact for the entire team, providing both expert strategic thinking and leadership skills, working directly with the Business Line Managers, and the country leadership team.
Be a part of a team where you will:

Partner with the leaders in the team, always aligned with People processes, to translate strategic objectives into project delivery
Design and implement employment guidelines and integrate global People processes relevant to your client areas.
Ensure compliance with each country and EU legislation Design strategic initiatives through the generation of relevant data and analysis Act as a Business Partner, strategic solution provider, advisor and coach for the leaders in the team.
Support line managers by providing valuable input and expertise to the team on Hiring processes, Employment laws, HR policies, HR processes, Compensations, Relocations, Expats, etc.
Lead growth projects within the teams you support as well as reorganizations according to business needs.
Partner with the other People teams to manage employee relations, labor relations and disciplinary actions regarding the. Keep perspective and possible impacts on the Business.
Partner with client area's leadership to identify business needs aligned with organization plans and team growth (structure, costs) and partner with the People Acquisition team to ensure and enable the correct recruitment process: design JDs, understand current markets, benefits offered, etc.
Support the business to identify mid and long-term capability needs, in order to implement a learning and development process and ensure a continuous learning environment.
Ensure development is a key topic in Glovo, making it a core topic at the leadership level within the client teams.
Ensure the performance review process with high-quality discussion, and implement and manage a career path for key roles and secure succession planning.
Maintain a strong focus on employee relations, monitor employee engagement, and retention activities.
Be responsible for key people processes implementation: performance & recognition, compensation cycles, talent review, employee relations, engagement.
Build strong ongoing relationships with the People and partner area's team, in order to identify new opportunities for the development of different initiatives regarding People processes.
Actively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference
Ensure, with responsibility over the office management, the life at Glovo culture is being lived and enjoyed in your scope. Fostering a positive and productive work environment in alignment with our values! 

You have:

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business Administration, Psychology or related fields.
A business-first attitude.
Experience in highly demanding environments and in a similar role for more than 4 years.
Experience in startups will be highly valued, either by having directly worked in a similar company or managing a new project unit in a larger organization.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills at all levels.
Ability to adapt, execute 360º and coordinate with the team.
Fluency in English. Any local language will be a big plus.
Knowledge of Country employment and labor law as a strong plus.
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude 

We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!
Experience our Glovo Life benefits:


Enticing equity plan


Top-notch private health insurance


Zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!


Flexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)


Enhanced parental leave including nursery support!


Online therapy and wellbeing benefit


What you’ll find when working at Glovo:


Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly


Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openly


Stay Humble: Self-aware and open to learning


Care: Uplift people and the planet


Glownership: Act as proud owners


High Bar: Focus on Top Performance


If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!


Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

questions.description:
When you apply to a job on this site, the personal data contained in your
application will be collected by GlovoApp23, S.L. (“Controller”), which is located at
C/ Pujades 94, 08005, Barcelona, Spain. Controller’s data protection officer belongs to
the legal team and can be contacted at legal@glovoapp.com. Your personal
data will be processed for the purposes of the Controller’s recruitment related
activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for
applicants, contacting previous companies where the applicant has been
employed in order to check references (upon prior consent from the applicant),
evaluating and assessing the results thereto, and, as is otherwise needed in the
recruitment and hiring processes - such may be analysing your skills for the
proposed role, The Controller may also use your data to present different roles
that may suit your interests and/or skills. Such processing is legally permissible
under Art. 6(1)(a), (b) and (f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection
Regulation) based on the consent of the applicant by submitting the
application, as necessary for the purposes of conducting precontractual
activities, directly requested by the applicant by submitting the candidature,
addressed to analyse the possibilities of establishing a labour relation between
the Controller and the applicant, and for the legitimate interests pursued by the
Controller, which are the application, evaluation, and selection of applicants for
employment.
Your personal data will be shared with Greenhouse Software, Inc. of whom are a
cloud services and applicant tracking provider located in the United States of
America and engaged by the Controller to help manage their recruitment and
hiring processes. Accordingly, if you are located outside of the United States,
your personal data will be transferred to the United States once you submit it to
this site. Because the European Union Commission has determined that the
United States data privacy laws do not ensure an adequate level of protection for
personal data collected from EU data subjects, the transfer will be subject to
appropriate additional safeguards under either the standard contractual clauses
and/or the Privacy Shield. You can obtain a copy of the standard contractual
clauses by contacting us at legal@glovoapp.com. At the same time, your data
and the inputs of the recruitment process will be stored on Google, Inc and
Amazon Web Services servers, acting as processors, both of which comply with
the General Data Protection Regulations and have a written agreement with the
Controller. Depending on the offer applied, your personal information may be
transferred to other companies of the Controller’s group for the same purposes
as established before and acting as a processor.
Your personal data will be retained by the Controller as long as needed to fulfil
the requirements of the above mentioned purposes. In case the recruitment
process does not end with the establishment of a labour relationship between
the applicant and the Controller, the Controller will retain the applicant’s data for
a period of 3 years from the date of the last communication, issued either by You
or the Controller, declaring the end of the recruitment process without sending
and/or accepting the possible offer.
Under the GDPR, you have the right to request access to your personal data, to
request that your personal data be rectified, cancelled or erased, and/or to
request that processing of your personal data be limited. In case You consider

your rights have been violated, you also have to right to data portability. In
addition, you may lodge a complaint with an EU supervisory authority.
By consenting and submitting the candidature, the applicant confirms that they
have read and are informed about the processing of personal data by the
Controller and gives the necessary consent to comply with Controller’s activities
regarding the recruitment process.
